chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen L Wall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Use only 1 dispensary.  May possess another person's prescription only for employment purposes.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other means with Jason Brown or Robert Fitzpatrick, or any user or dealer of illegal substances.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Response from Judge Becker to defendant.
from defendant to Judge
Received ex-parte communication from the defendant.  Returned with instructional letter from Judge's office.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Amend Count 1 to misd.  Amended information filed with the court.  Count 3 amended.  Poss controlled substance.  (1).  Count 2 as originally charged.  Count 3 Poss drug para.  Reading of amended information waived.  Plead no contest to all counts as misdemeanors.  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation, with conditions.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understands.  Defense stipulated as to a factual basis for the charges.  Court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Finds that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Find guilty of 961.41(3g)(d), 961.573(1) X2.  State recommends 2 years probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC. AODA. Seek and maintain employment.    No contact with JB or an other user of illegal substances.  Not to possess any other person's prescription, unless for employment purposes.  Must advise agent if she does.  Defendant elected to exercise her right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld:  2 years probation.  Concurrent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC. AODA and recommended treatment/counseling.  Seek and maintain employment.   No contact with J.B., R.F.  or any other user or dealer of illegal substances.  Not to possess any other person's prescription, unless for employment purposes only.  If she has prescriptions, take only as prescribed.  Only 1 dispensary.
Plea hearing at 09-14-2015 01:30 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Defense waiting for some lab results. State says they have the reports.  Parties working towards a resolution.  Set for a plea 9/14/15 at 1:30 pm.
Status conference at 08-10-2015 03:00 pm

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  State called Deputy A.J.  Sworn.  Questioned by State regarding the stop.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflects identification.  Attorney Sebion questioned the witness.  State follow up questions.  Attorney Sebion recross.  State gave final argument.  Attorney Sebion gave final argument.  State responded.  Court denied motion to suppress.  Wyoming v. Houghton.  STC set for 8/10/15 at 3 pm
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on A.J. to appear at motion hearing on 7/23/15.

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.   ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant will waive her right to preliminary hearing.  Court reviews Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing from with defendant.  Also reviews felony counts and her right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant knowingly, intelligently, and freely waives right to preliminary hearing and is bound over for trial.  Proceed to arraignment - defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty pleas to all 3 counts.  Case already has been pre-trialed.  Sebion filed a Motion to Suppress and requests a hearing be scheduled.  Court directed her to schedule for 1 hour with judicial assistant.
Motion hearing at 07-23-2015 11:00 am

Defendant appeared with counse SPD Carly Sebion.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Sebion states they hae an offer but she will be filing a motion and have the case set for a motion hearing.  Also need to schedule preliminary hearing.  Court said to schedule preliminary hearing for 1/2 hour with judicial assistant.
Preliminary hearing at 05-27-2015 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 04-15-2015 10:00 am
Status conference at 05-04-2015 03:00 pm
Court questioned defendant on her understanding of waiver of time limits.  Court found she understood waiver of time limits.  PTC & STC dates set.
